context:
|  | For the year ended December 31, | 
--- | --- | --- | ---
 | 2017 | 2018 | 2019
Basic earnings/(loss) per share |  |  | 
Profit/(loss) for the year attributable to owners of the Group | 15,506 | 47,683 | (100,661)
Less: Dividends on Preference Shares | (10,064) | (10,063) | (10,063)
Profit/(loss) for the year available to owners of the Group | 5,442 | 37,620 | (110,724)
Weighted average number of shares outstanding, basic | 80,622,788 | 80,792,837 | 80,849,818
Basic earnings/(loss) per share | 0.07 | 0.47 | (1.37)
Diluted earnings/(loss) per share |  |  | 
Profit/(loss) for the year available to owners of the Group used in the calculation of diluted EPS | 5,442 | 37,620 | (110,724)
Weighted average number of shares outstanding, basic | 80,622,788 | 80,792,837 | 80,849,818
Dilutive potential ordinary shares | 643,342 | 844,185 | —
Weighted average number of shares used in the calculation of diluted EPS | 81,266,130 | 81,637,022 | 80,849,818
Diluted earnings/(loss) per share | 0.07 | 0.46 | (1.37)

paragraph 1: GasLog Ltd. and its Subsidiaries
Notes to the consolidated financial statements (Continued)
For the years ended December 31, 2017, 2018 and 2019
(All amounts expressed in thousands of U.S. Dollars, except share and per share data)
paragraph 2: 29. Earnings/(losses) per share (‘‘EPS’’)
paragraph 3: Basic earnings/(losses) per share was calculated by dividing the profit/(loss) for the year attributable to the owners of the common shares after deducting the dividend on Preference Shares by the weighted average number of common shares issued and outstanding during the year.
paragraph 4: Diluted EPS is calculated by dividing the profit/(loss) for the year attributable to the owners of the Group adjusted for the effects of all dilutive potential ordinary shares by the weighted average number of all potential ordinary shares assumed to have been converted into common shares, unless such potential ordinary shares have an antidilutive effect.
paragraph 5: The following reflects the earnings/(losses) and share data used in the basic and diluted earnings/ (losses) per share computations:
paragraph 6: The Group excluded the effect of 2,630,173 SARs and 367,162 RSUs in calculating diluted EPS for the year ended December 31, 2019, as they were anti-dilutive (December 31, 2018: 555,453 SARs and 0 RSUs, December 31, 2017: 998,502 SARs and 0 RSUs).

qa.question: How was diluted EPS calculated?
qa.answer: ['Diluted EPS is calculated by dividing the profit/(loss) for the year attributable to the owners of the Group adjusted for the effects of all dilutive potential ordinary shares by the weighted average number of all potential ordinary shares assumed to have been converted into common shares, unless such potential ordinary shares have an antidilutive effect.']

tat_1538_1.Answer Analysis: The answer provides a detailed method for calculating diluted EPS, involving the division of adjusted profit or loss by the weighted average number of potential ordinary shares, excluding antidilutive effects.
tat_1538_1.Document Content Analysis: The document explains the computation of diluted EPS for RiceBran Technologies, detailing the division of net income by the weighted average number of common shares, including the impact of potential exercises and conversions. tat_1876_0.Query Analysis: The query seeks an explanation of how diluted Earnings Per Share (EPS) is calculated.
tat_1876_0.Answer Analysis: The answer explains that diluted EPS is calculated by adjusting the profit or loss for the year attributable to the owners of the Group for all dilutive potential ordinary shares and then dividing by the weighted average number of all potential ordinary shares assumed to have been converted into common shares, excluding those with an antidilutive effect.

tat_1876_0.Query Analysis: The query asks for the method of calculating diluted earnings per share (EPS).
tat_1876_0.Answer Analysis: The answer explains that diluted EPS is calculated by dividing the profit/(loss) for the year attributable to the owners of the Group, adjusted for the effects of all dilutive potential ordinary shares, by the weighted average number of all potential ordinary shares assumed to have been converted into common shares, unless such potential ordinary shares have an antidilutive effect.
tat_1876_0.Document Content Analysis: The document provides details on the calculation of basic and diluted EPS, including the weighted average number of shares outstanding, dilutive common share equivalents, and the treasury stock method.
